theorem Topology.P3_union_left_dense
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X} :
    Dense A → Topology.P3 (A ∪ B) := by
  intro hDense
  dsimp [Topology.P3]
  intro x hx
  -- `closure A` is the whole space because `A` is dense.
  have hclA : closure A = (Set.univ : Set X) := by
    simpa using hDense.closure_eq
  -- Hence `closure (A ∪ B)` is also the whole space.
  have hcl : closure (A ∪ B) = (Set.univ : Set X) := by
    -- `closure A ⊆ closure (A ∪ B)`
    have hmono : closure A ⊆ closure (A ∪ B) :=
      closure_mono (Set.subset_union_left : (A : Set X) ⊆ A ∪ B)
    -- Combine inclusions to obtain the equality.
    have : (Set.univ : Set X) ⊆ closure (A ∪ B) := by
      intro y _
      have : y ∈ closure A := by
        simpa [hclA] using (by simp : y ∈ (Set.univ : Set X))
      exact hmono this
    exact Set.Subset.antisymm (by intro _ _; simp) this
  -- The interior of `univ` is `univ`, so the goal is immediate.
  have hInt : interior (closure (A ∪ B)) = (Set.univ : Set X) := by
    simpa [hcl, interior_univ]
  have : x ∈ (Set.univ : Set X) := by
    simp
  simpa [hInt] using this

theorem Topology.interior_closure_union_subset
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X} :
    interior (closure (A : Set X)) ∪ interior (closure B) ⊆
      interior (closure A ∪ closure B) := by
  intro x hx
  cases hx with
  | inl hxA =>
      -- `closure A` is contained in `closure A ∪ closure B`
      have hsubset : closure A ⊆ closure A ∪ closure B := by
        intro y hy
        exact Or.inl hy
      -- Apply monotonicity of `interior`
      have hmono : interior (closure A) ⊆ interior (closure A ∪ closure B) :=
        interior_mono hsubset
      exact hmono hxA
  | inr hxB =>
      -- `closure B` is contained in `closure A ∪ closure B`
      have hsubset : closure B ⊆ closure A ∪ closure B := by
        intro y hy
        exact Or.inr hy
      -- Apply monotonicity of `interior`
      have hmono : interior (closure B) ⊆ interior (closure A ∪ closure B) :=
        interior_mono hsubset
      exact hmono hxB

theorem Topology.P1_and_P2_iff_isOpen_of_isClosed
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A : Set X} (hA : IsClosed A) :
    (Topology.P1 A ∧ Topology.P2 A) ↔ IsOpen A := by
  -- Existing equivalence between `P2` and openness for closed sets.
  have hEq : Topology.P2 A ↔ IsOpen A :=
    Topology.P2_iff_isOpen_of_isClosed (A := A) hA
  -- Prove each direction.
  constructor
  · rintro ⟨_, hP2⟩
    exact hEq.mp hP2
  · intro hOpen
    exact And.intro
      (Topology.P1_of_isOpen (A := A) hOpen)
      (hEq.mpr hOpen)
